page.title: 18Life in Winston Today (ctd)
page.content: the proposal by a mining concern to open a drift mine at Osmondcroft Farm to the west of the village which would employ 22 people and produce 14,400 tons of coal a year. The local action committee has the support of the County Planning Officer in the matter who feels that the proposed plan could spoil the area's natural beauty. The small cluster of houses across the River Tees from Winston, known as Winston Gate, stood on land owned by the Earl of Harewood which was sold in the early 1920s for private dwellings. The "Board Inn" which once stood there, has been converted into a private dwelling.
